byline.contributor: Omar Al-Jawoshy contributed reporting from Baghdad; Kamil Kakol from Sulaimaniya, Iraq; and an employee of The New York Times from Mosul, Iraq.

abstract: Iraqi forensics experts unearth bodies in mass grave outside Tikrit believed to be air force cadets massacred by Islamic State in June; graves contain 57 of 1,686 cadets registered as missing.
lead_paragraph: In Tikrit, officials began exhuming bodies that are thought to be some of the nearly 1,700 air force cadets massacred by the Islamic State.

headline.main: Iraq Empties Mass Graves in Search for Cadets Killed by ISIS
headline.print_headline: Iraq Empties Mass Graves in Search for Missing Cadets

snippet: In Tikrit, officials began exhuming bodies that are thought to be some of the nearly 1,700 air force cadets massacred by the Islamic State.

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations
